post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

Espero que les guste!!

# Grupo de Chat de Soft y Hard Libre en Tox

Estoy manteniendo un grupo de **Soft y Hard Libre** en Tox, pueden sumarse agregando el bot Groupbot a Tox: `56A1ADE4B65B86BCD51CC73E2CD4E542179F47959FE3E0E21B4B0ACDADE51855D34D34D37CB5`

y buscando el grupo con el comando `info`, y luego entrando con el comando `invite`.
Por ejemplo si el grupo es el 5 escriben `invite 5`.

*¬°¬°Los Esperamos!!*

Wow! a holographic display on Kickstarter!
https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYJkanQL1MRL9uDkPEth7SFFg8PcPtE6uRhL1MRiCKv7Z
> The Holovect Mk II is a self-contained laser-based volumetric display system that fits on your lab bench or desktop. It is the perfect companion to a 3D printer and a stand-alone educational or promotional device. The Holovect Mk II is the first commercially available, laser-based desktop "holographic" display, capable of drawing 3D objects in air with light. 
> With the holovect technology, we have invented how to control air within a box shaped section of  space to precisely modify the RI within specific regions to refract and reflect a laser beam. This modification raises the ‚Äúalbedo‚Äù which is defined as the proportion of the incident light that is reflected by a surface, as well as the refractive properties at the boundary between the modified and unmodified air. Therefore by simultaneously controlling the aim of the laser and the position of a modified air column, a computer can place a volumetric pixel or voxel of light anywhere in 3D space.

# [Crear un sitio en ZeroNet desde 0 en 2 minutos](/1EMcXwk7qQdY3pbj86A98gZHjDBNRrscdL/?Post:38:Crear+un+sitio+en+ZeroNet+desde+0+en+2+minutos)
Una de las maneras mas comunes de crear un sitio en ZeroNet es clonando uno ya existente, pero a veces queremos simplemente crear un sitio desde cero, aqu√≠ te explico como.

Algunas citas del documento *Halloween* (a√±o 1998) de Micro$oft. Fuente: http://www.tikismikis.org/os/documento-halloween.html

> - El OSS representa una amenaza directa, a corto plazo al ingreso y al dominio de la plataforma a Microsoft, especialmente en el √°mbito de los servidores. Adem√°s, el paralelismo intr√≠nseco, y el libre intercambio de ideas dentro del OSS tiene beneficios que no puede reproducir nuestro actual modelo de licenciamiento, y por tanto, representan una amenaza hacia el intercambio de ideas entre los desarrolladores.
> - Estudios recientes de casos (el Internet) proporcionan evidencia muy dram√°tica ... de que la calidad comercial puede lograrse/superarse por parte de los proyectos de OSS.
> -  ... para comprender c√≥mo competir en contra del OSS, debemos dirigirnos en contra de un proceso, en vez de una compa√±√≠a.
> - El OSS tiene una credibilidad a largo plazo... por lo que las t√°cticas FUD no pueden ser empleadas para combatirlo.
> - Linux y otros entusiastas del OSS est√°n haciendo cada vez m√°s cre√≠ble el planteamiento de que el software OSS es al menos tan robusto "C, si no es que m√°s "C que las alternativas comerciales. El Internet proporciona el escaparate ideal, de gran visibilidad para el mundo OSS.
> - Linux ha sido empleado en ambientes comerciales, de misiones cr√≠ticas con excelentes resultados y testimonios p√∫blicos. ... Linux tiene un mejor desempe√±o que muchos otros UNIXes ... Linux est√° sobre el camino de ser eventualmente due√±o del mercado UNIX de las x86 ...
> - Linux puede ganar mientras los servicios/protocolos sean mercanc√≠as sujetas a la venta.
> - Los proyectos OSS han sido capaces de ganarse un punto de arranque en muchas aplicaciones de servidores debido a la amplia utilizaci√≥n de protocolos sencillos y personalizados. Al extender estos protocolos y desarrollar nuevos protocolos, podemos evitar la entrada de los proyectos OSS al mercado.
> - La capacidad del proceso OSS para reunir y forjar un coeficiente intelectual colectivo de millares de individuos a trav√©s de Internet es simplemente sorprendente. Es m√°s, la evangelizaci√≥n del OSS crece proporcionalmente mucho m√°s r√°pido con el Internet de lo que nuestros propios esfuerzos de evangelizaci√≥n parecen crecer.

# [Crash testing](/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:1:Crash+testing)

> Recent attacks on the internet could be a prelude to far worse ones
> ‚ÄúSOMEONE is learning how to take down the internet.‚Äù This was the headline of a blog post Bruce Schneier, a noted cyber-security expert, wrote in mid-September. It looked prescient when, on October 21st, Dynamic Network Services (Dyn), a firm that is part of the internet-address system, was disrupted by what is called a ‚Äúdistributed denial of service‚Äù (DDoS) attack. (Essentially, a DDoS floods servers with requests until they can no longer cope.) For hours, hundreds of sites were hard to reach, including those of Netflix, PayPal and Twitter.

# [Mar del Plata, una pel√≠cula de terror](/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:10:Mar+del+Plata,+una+pel%C3%ADcula+de+terror)

El periodista de lavaca, Bruno Ciancaglini, viaj√≥ a Mar del Plata para cubrir el Festival Internacional de Cine. En la madrugada del s√°bado fue esposado y retenido durante 4 horas en un patrullero. Un testimonio en primera persona de la pesadilla que representa estar en manos de la Bonaerense. #Argentina

# [Mar del Plata, una pel√≠cula de terror: investigan a la Bonaerense](/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:11:Mar+del+Plata,+una+pel%C3%ADcula+de+terror:+investigan+a+la+Bonaerense)

La repercusi√≥n de la denuncia del integrante de lavaca Bruno Ciancaglini impuls√≥ la apertura de un sumario administrativo a cargo de la Auditor√≠a General de Asuntos Internos del Ministerio de Seguridad provincial. No hay noticias a√∫n de que el Ministerio P√∫blico Fiscal haya abierto una investigaci√≥n, tal como es su obligaci√≥n. Qu√© dice el fiscal que fue consultado esa madrugada de terror por la polic√≠a. El caso origin√≥ que muchos marplatenses compartieran sus experiencias de abusos policiales, pero tambi√©n su impotencia por la impunidad que los protege, por inacci√≥n de la justicia. #Argentina

# [The World's First Open Source RISC-V-based 32-bit ŒºC](/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:12:The+World%27s+First+Open+Source+RISC-V-based+32-bit+%CE%BCC)

> The OnChip Open-V microcontroller is a completely free (as in freedom) and open source 32-bit microcontroller based on the RISC-V architecture. The Open-V has a host of built-in peripherals you‚Äôd expect of any modern microcontroller and was designed to compete with the capabilities of ARM M0-based microcontrollers. This crowdfunding campaign will bring the Open-V into mass production and make it widely available to anyone. If you love hacking on embedded controllers, breaking down closed-source barriers, having the freedom to learn how things work even down to the transistor level, or have dreamed of spinning your own silicon, then this campaign is for you and we need your help!

# rDany Slack team

Hi people, I am working on a ‚Äúopen domain, long conversations generative chatbot‚Äù called rDany, is a free software project, now in an early beta phase. If you are interested on contributing, or just learn more about it join the slack, request an invitation here: rdany@rdany.org . Developers and artists welcomed!

Pavel Durov:
> If you haven‚Äôt read it yet, here‚Äôs the full story about the US agencies‚Äô attempts to infiltrate Telegram last year: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:20:The+Crypto-+Keepers

> It tells how the FBI tried to influence me and bribe our engineer in May 2016 to make Telegram less secure. Luckily, since neither of us are US citizens, we could afford to refuse their offers and I was able to tell the public about these attempts. If we were American citizens, the FBI would have likely tried to silence us using a legal procedure called a "gag order" ‚Äì when the US authorities can not only demand that you do something (like plant a backdoor into your app), but also prohibit you from telling the public about it (otherwise you can end up in jail).

# Public Money, Public Code - Open Letter

> Why is software created using taxpayers‚Äô money not released as Free Software?
> We want legislation requiring that publicly financed software developed for the public sector be made publicly available under a > Free and Open Source Software licence. If it is public money, it should be public code as well.
> Code paid by the people should be available to the people!

More info / Sign the Open Letter: https://publiccode.eu

## The IPFS dilemma

I don't know what is the most responsible way to link to IPFS content. What do you think?

- Should I link to a local address, meaning that only people with IPFS installed (and that specific address configured) will see the content? ( http://127.0.0.1:8080/ipfs )

- Or should I link to the clearnet address maybe exposing peoples IP?( https://ipfs.io/ipfs )

## [YouTube's Blocks MIT Courses, Blender Videos, and More](/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz/?Post:30)

Several popular YouTube accounts, including those belonging to 'MIT OpenCourseWare' and the 'Blender Foundation,' have had all their videos blocked. People who try to access the videos are informed that they are not available in their country, suggesting that YouTube's piracy filters have been triggered. It's unclear, however, who or what is to blame.

2. You can `ipfs pin add` the files you want to share forever, and `ipfs pin rm` files that you want to be eventually deleted from your cache. You can only `unpin` files you pined first.

4. Yes, immediately.

You can upload the .mp4 file to IPFS and add the video tag to the blog post, for instance:
```
<video controls style="max-width: 100%">
  <source src="https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/QmdTfmiWPLKVpXDrwGwpj1itJNvqd6SNLuDXKhwNvjHmLu" type="video/mp4">
Your browser does not support the video element.
</video> 
```
